wordProblems.problem: A store sold 12 items in the morning and 8 items in the afternoon. How many items were sold in total?
Sarah had 5 apples and bought 7 more. How many apples does she have now?
John read 15 pages on Monday and 20 pages on Tuesday. How many pages did he read in total?
A baker made 30 cupcakes and sold 17. How many cupcakes are left?
A car travels 50 miles in the morning and 75 miles in the afternoon. What is the total distance traveled?
Lisa bought 3 packs of pencils, and each pack contains 12 pencils. How many pencils does she have in total?
Mike has 6 rows of chairs. Each row has 8 chairs. How many chairs does he have in total?
A farmer has 9 cows and buys 6 more. How many cows does he have now?
A box contains 144 marbles, and John gives away 36. How many marbles are left?
A train leaves the station at 9 AM and arrives at 2 PM. How many hours was the journey?
A pizza is cut into 12 slices. If 5 people each take 2 slices, how many slices remain?
A basketball team scores 24 points in the first half and 37 points in the second half. What is their final score?
Tom saves $10 every week. How much will he have saved in 6 weeks?
A farmer harvests 500 apples but loses 75 due to bad weather. How many apples does he have left?
A student scores 78 on her first test and 85 on her second test. What is her total score?
A classroom has 28 students. If 7 students are absent, how many students are present?
A family buys 4 tickets to a movie. Each ticket costs $12. How much do they spend in total?
A baker makes 36 cookies and packages them in boxes of 6. How many boxes does he need?
A swimming pool holds 2,000 gallons of water. If 500 gallons evaporate, how much water remains?
A soccer team won 9 games, lost 3, and tied 2. How many total games did they play?
If you spend $4 per day on lunch, how much will you have spent in 5 days?
A box contains 96 crayons. If each student gets 8 crayons, how many students receive crayons?
A farmer plants 250 trees in 5 equal rows. How many trees are in each row?
A school has 540 students. If each classroom has 30 students, how many classrooms are there?
A person walks 2 miles each day. How many miles will they walk in 4 weeks?
A store sold 12 items in the morning and 8 items in the afternoon. How many items were sold in total?
